clinical_study.brief_title: Medication Reconciliation in Comparison to an Extensive Medication Safety Check
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Project to Investigate the Influence of Medication Reconciliation and an Extensive Medication Safety Check on the Number of Adverse Drug Events in the Elderly

collaborator.agency: Ärztliche Zentrum für Qualität in der Medizin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine wether an extensive medication safety check has a greater impact on the incidence of adverse drug events than medication reconciliation or no intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the clinical relevance of medication related problems as determined by the French Society of Clinical Pharmacy
secondary_outcome.description: Severity scale for medication related problems: minor, significative, major, critical, catastrophic

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the clinical relevance of discrepancies as determined by the French Society of Clinical Pharmacy
secondary_outcome.description: Severity scale for discrepancies: minor, significative, major, critical, catastrophic

secondary_outcome.measure: duration of taking the best possible medication history
secondary_outcome.description: The duration is measured in minutes.

arm_group.description: Patient randomized to the Control-Group will receive the traditional care by physician and nurse on the ward.
Patient randomized to the MedRec-Group will receive the traditional care by physician and nurse on the ward and additional pharmacist led medication reconciliation.
Patient randomized to the AMTS-Group will receive the traditional care by physician and nurse on the ward and additional pharmaceutical care by a pharmacist.

intervention.description: Pharmacist take the best possible medication history (BPMH), comparison of the BPMH with the admission order (AMO), clarify and solve al discrepancies between the BPMH and the AMO.

Checking medication under safety considerations (medication at admission, during hospital stay, at discharge); recommendations for inappropriate medication (e.g. contraindications or interactions) or medication related problems. Pharmaceutical care includes Medication Reconciliation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient 65 years and older
- written informed consent patient or the legal representative
- existing medication therapy at hospitalization
- admission to one of the project wards via emergency department (non elective)
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients included in the study previously
